dataList.dlg:
- This sparring match shouldn't cause you much trouble, my lady. With your wisdom, your courage, your perseverance, your fashion sense, your passionate—
- Wei... have you been hanging around Outis lately? Stop that, it's embarrassing.

- You needn't be so tense, my lady.
- ... Is it really that obvious?
- Not as much as it used to be. We have Rodion to thank for this, I believe.

- Perhaps it is about time you took a break, my lady.
- ... No, no. There's still a whole lot for me to learn.

I thought I'd been preparing my whole life to be the Family Hierarch... but I never felt the pressure until now. Until I actually got myself a solid idea of what my vision for Hongyuan is.
I was so lacking then... in both learning and effort.

- This seems like a good place to end the sparring match.
- Hey, don't get yourself killed over this. You're one of Hongyuan's citizens I gotta take care of as the Hierarch.

- My lady, it seems that the members of your clan are quite... indisposed.
- Seriously...? Just how long have they been working?!

- You've defeated the opponent with a wonderful maneuver.
- ... Take them to a doctor. I'll pay for the treatment if necessary.

- One of your clan members who's been on paperwork duty has... passed out.
- ... Haah. Yeah, get him home. I'll leave the rest of his work to you, Wei.
- ... I'm sorry!? My lady, what— My lady!?
The great Fixers in Don Quixote's tales never, ever gave up, no matter what trial came their way. So, I'm not going to back down either. Not if I want to be as incandescent as them.

- Hey... maybe I've got some real genius potential.
- Of course, my lady. Only Faust and Yi Sang may even dream of matching your genius—
- Too much, Wei. Too much.
- ... Apologies.

- Perhaps the situation calls for caution...
- Maybe this is what big bro Baoyu meant by "a hunch"? My hunch tells me that... tells me that I got this.
- I will follow your judgment, my lady.

- ... We have but a few days until the vote, my lady.
- Yeah, I gotta make some tangible progress, and soon. Something concrete enough to change their minds.

- My lady, must employ our best strategy against this, or risk defeat.
- Agreed. I gotta pour everything I learned into this.
... And here I thought I saw all there was to see here in Daguanyuan... Guess I'll have to keep my guard up.

- Bravo...! Bravo, my lady! I'll give that maneuver ten out of ten!
- Hmph, I could've done that blindfolded.

- That, uh... I think you've brought the wrong weapon, my lady.
- H-hey... that Heathcliff guy told me how morale's what really matters in a fight, okay?

- Weakpoint struck.
- How brief... This must be Meursault's teaching.
- Mm...
- Y-you could at least say something, my lady.

- My lady...?
- ... F-forget you saw that! I just slipped, that's all.

- ... Hey, I think the classes are working.
- And for that, I am glad. It seems that they have quite the skill in the art of teaching.

- They seem to be under the weather.
- Which means an opportunity for me. I wasn't going to show them any mercy anyhow.

- Why are they helping me all of a sudden? What kind of game are they playing?
- It is suspicious indeed, but... it doesn't seem particularly detrimental.

- My lady, you're wearing that same look Gregor had at the end of his class.
- ... It's not that bad. I'm just a bit under the weather.
They'll find it quite difficult to scheme without their limbs.
Now, this should give me some time to study and train without worrying about getting ambushed.

- My lady...!
- Don't help me, Wei. I'm the Family Hierarch of Hongyuan... I should be able to overcome a trial like this.

Back in La Manchaland... during the Family Hierarch war... I've lost too many good people already. I can't be a bumbling candidate forever.
Jia Xichun, the Family Hierarch of Hongyuan, will never fail her people again.
You've certainly gotten the upper hand of the battle quickly. At this rate, this sparring match should end swiftly in your favor, my lady.

- Things rarely ever went this well, even in J&J...
- J&J? Do you mean Jianghu Journeys, that game Ishmael ran on top of a table, my lady?
- It's no game, Wei. It's an adventure.

- Emptiness of sound, form, and mind. You've absorbed his teaching into your heart, my lady.
- But I can do better than this. Sinclair did.

- Flawless victory, my lady. Congratulations are in order. Even the children of the four great houses will have no choice but to admit your competency.
- ... It's all thanks to their excellent classes. I've learned a lot.

- Don't let this victory get to your head... Next time, I won't lose.
- My lady...
- … Wei, we're leaving.
- ... Very well. I will prepare the resources to review today's spar.

- What are you doing...?
- Producing a detailed record of my ladyship's classes and sparring matches.
- Wha-what?! Why would you do that!?
- Well, I thought it would be beneficial to leave as many records of your exploits as possible, now that you have become the Family Hierarch.
